<meta name="description" content="Three programs lead to the M. A. in Philosophy. The general program providing a grounding in all branches of the subject.   The Special program in Symbolic Systems and the Special Program in the Philosophy of Language provide special training in their respective branches." />

          <div id="content-wrapper" class="content-wrapper">
            <div id="content-head" class="row-fluid content-head">
                                                        <h1 class="title" id="page-title"> Masters Program </h1>
                                                                                                </div>
                                                <div id="content-body" class="row-fluid content-body"> <div class="region region-content clearfix">
  <div id="block-system-main" class="clearfix block block-system">       <div class="content"> <article id="node-107" class="node node-stanford-page clearfix" about="/degree-programs/graduate/masters-program" typeof="sioc:Item foaf:Document">      <span property="dc:title" content="Masters Program" class="rdf-meta element-hidden"></span>    <div class="content">
    <div id="node-stanford-page-full-group-s-postcard" class="postcard"><div id="node-stanford-page-full-group-s-postcard-content" class="postcard-content"><div class="field field-name-body field-type-text-with-summary field-label-hidden"><div class="field-items"><div class="field-item even" property="content:encoded"><p class="summary">Three programs lead to the M. A. in Philosophy.</p>
<ul><li>
		<p class="summary">The general program providing a grounding in all branches of the subject. </p>
	</li>
	<li>
		<p class="summary">The<span> Special program in Symbolic Systems and the Special Program in the Philosophy of Language</span> provide special training in their respective branches.</p>
	</li>
</ul><h4><span>General Program</span></h4>
<p>The General Program requires a minimum of 45 units in Philosophy courses numbered above 99. These courses must be taken for a letter grade, and the student must receive at least a 'B-' in the course. Courses taken to satisfy the undergraduate core or affiliated courses may not be counted in the 45 units. </p>
<h4>Special Program in Symbolic Systems</h4>
<p>Students should have the equivalent of the Stanford undergraduate major in Symbolic Systems. Students who have a strong major in one of the basic SSP disciplines (philosophy, psychology, linguistics, computer science) may be admitted, but are required to do a substantial part of the undergraduate SSP core in each of the other basic SSP fields. </p>
<h4>Special Program in the Philosophy of Language</h4>
<p>Admission is limited to students with substantial preparation in philosophy or linguistics. Those whose primary preparation has been in linguistics may be required to satisfy all or part of the undergraduate core requirements as described in the "General Program" subsection above. Those whose preparation is primarily in philosophy may be required to take additional courses in linguistics.</p>
<p><a class="more-link" href="https://philosophy.stanford.edu/degree-programs/graduate/graduate-admissions" rel="nofollow">How to Apply</a></p>
<h2>Coterm</h2>
<p>Current Stanford Undergraduates are eligible to apply as coterminal bachelor's and master's degree students. There is a separate application process for coterms.</p>
<p><span>More details about  </span><a class="more-link" href="https://philosophy.stanford.edu/degree-programs/graduate/masters/coterminal-masters" rel="nofollow">coterm in Philosophy</a></p>
<h2>Masters Funding</h2>
<p>No funding is available for Masters students. Please check the <a href="http://financialaid.stanford.edu/grad/">Financial Aid website</a> for information about loans and outside sources to fund your MA.</p>
<h2>Requirements</h2>
<p>The most up to date version of requirements is always in <a href="http://exploredegrees.stanford.edu/schoolofhumanitiesandsciences/philosophy/#masterstext">exploredegrees</a>.   <a class="more-link" href="http://exploredegrees.stanford.edu/schoolofhumanitiesandsciences/philosophy/#masterstext">current MA requirements</a></p>
<h3>Unit Requirements</h3>
<p>Each program requires a minimum of 45 units in philosophy. Students in a special program may be allowed or required to replace up to 9 units of philosophy by 9 units in the field of specialization. Although the requirements for the M.A. are designed so that a student with the equivalent of a strong undergraduate philosophy major at Stanford might complete them in one year, most students need longer. Students should also keep in mind that although 45 units is the minimum required by the University, quite often more units are necessary to complete department requirements. Up to 6 units of directed reading in philosophy may be allowed. There is no thesis requirement, but an optional master's thesis or project, upon faculty approval, may count as the equivalent of up to 8 units. A special program may require knowledge of a foreign language. At least 45 units in courses numbered 100 or above must be completed with a grade of 'B-' or better at Stanford. Students are reminded of the University requirements for advanced degrees, and particularly of the fact that for the M.A., students must complete three full quarters as measured by tuition payment.</p>
<hr /><h3>General Program</h3>
<p>The General Program requires a minimum of 45 units in Philosophy courses numbered above 99. These courses must be taken for a letter grade, and the student must receive at least a 'B-' in the course. Courses taken to satisfy the undergraduate core or affiliated courses may not be counted in the 45 units. The requirement has three parts:</p>
<h4>Undergraduate Core</h4>
<ol><li>
		<p>Students must have when they enter, or complete early in their program, the following undergraduate courses (students entering from other institutions should establish equivalent requirements with a master's adviser upon arrival or earlier):</p>
		<ol><li>Logic: one of the following: Phil 50, Phil 150, Phil 151, Phil 154</li>
			<li>Philosophy of science: This requirement may be satisfied by <a href="http://exploredegrees.stanford.edu/search/?P=PHIL%2060" title="PHIL 60">PHIL 60</a>, <a href="http://exploredegrees.stanford.edu/search/?P=PHIL%2061" title="PHIL 61">PHIL 61</a>, or any intermediate philosophy of science course numbered between PHIL 160 - 169.</li>
			<li>Moral and political philosophy: This requirement may be satisfied by any intermediate course devoted to central topics in moral and political philosophy numbered between PHIL 170 - 172, or PHIL 174-176. </li>
			<li>Contemporary theoretical philosophy: This requirement may be satisfied by any intermediate course numbered between PHIL 180 - 189.</li>
			<li>History of philosophy: two history of philosophy courses numbered 100 or above</li>
		</ol></li>
</ol><h4>Graduate Core</h4>
<ol><li>
		<p>Students must take at least one course numbered over 105 from three of the following five areas (courses used to satisfy the undergraduate core cannot also be counted toward satisfaction of the graduate core). Crosslisted and other courses taught outside the Department of Philosophy do not count towards satisfaction of the core.</p>
		<ol><li>Logic and semantics</li>
			<li>Philosophy of science and history of science</li>
			<li>Ethics, value theory, and moral and political philosophy</li>
			<li>Metaphysics, epistemology, philosophy of mind, and philosophy of language</li>
			<li>History of philosophy</li>
		</ol></li>
</ol><h4>200-Level Course Requirement</h4>
<ol><li>
		<p>Each master's candidate must take at least two courses numbered above 200; these cannot be graduate sections of undergraduate courses.</p>
	</li>
</ol><h4>Specialization</h4>
<ol><li>
		<p>Students must take at least three courses numbered over 105 in one of the five areas.</p>
	</li>
</ol><hr /><h3>Special Program in Symbolic Systems</h3>
<p>The Special Program in Symbolic Systems is a one-year master's program and requires 45-units in philosophy. Students should have the equivalent of the Stanford undergraduate major in Symbolic Systems to pursue the Philosophy MA program in Symbolic Systems.  Students who have a strong major in one of the basic Symbolic Systems disciplines (philosophy, psychology, linguistics, computer science) may be admitted, but are required to do a substantial part of the undergraduate symbolic systems core in each of the other basic symbolic systems fields. The following philosophy courses are required:</p>
<ol><li>PHIL 80: Mind, Matter, and Meaning</li>
	<li>PHIL 151: Metalogic</li>
	<li>One of the following:</li>
</ol><ul><li>PHIL 181: Philosophy of Language</li>
	<li>PHIL 184: Theory of Knowledge</li>
	<li>PHIL 186: Philosophy of Mind</li>
	<li>PHIL 187: Philosophy of Action</li>
</ul><p>This work does not count towards the 45-unit requirement.</p>
<h4>REQUIREMENTS</h4>
<p>I. Four courses in philosophy at the graduate level (numbered 200 or above), including courses from three of the following five areas:</p>
<ol><li>Philosophy of language</li>
	<li>Logic</li>
	<li>Philosophy of mind</li>
	<li>Metaphysics and epistemology</li>
	<li>Philosophy of science</li>
</ol><p>At most two of the four courses may be graduate sections of undergraduate courses numbered 100 or higher.</p>
<p>II. Three courses numbered 100 or higher from outside Philosophy, chosen in consultation with an adviser. These courses should be from two of the following four areas:</p>
<ol><li>Psychology</li>
	<li>Linguistics</li>
	<li>Computer Science</li>
	<li>Education</li>
</ol><p>Remaining courses are chosen in consultation with and approved by an adviser.</p>
<p>Full details about the <a class="more-link" href="http://exploredegrees.stanford.edu/schoolofhumanitiesandsciences/philosophy/#masterstext">PHILOSOPHY MA SPECIAL PROGRAM IN SYMBOLIC SYSTEMS</a></p>
<div>
	<hr /><h3><span>Special Program in the Philosophy of Language</span></h3>
</div>
<p>Admission is limited to students with substantial preparation in philosophy or linguistics. Those whose primary preparation has been in linguistics may be required to satisfy all or part of the undergraduate core requirements as described in the "General Program" subsection above. Those whose preparation is primarily in philosophy may be required to take additional courses in linguistics.</p>
<h4>Course Requirements</h4>
<ol><li>Philosophy of language: two approved courses in the philosophy of language numbered 180 or higher.</li>
	<li>Syntactic theory and generative grammar: PHIl 384, LINGUIST 230A, </li>
	<li>Logic: at least two approved courses numbered <a href="http://exploredegrees.stanford.edu/search/?P=PHIL%20151" title="PHIL 151">PHIL 151</a> Metalogic or higher.</li>
	<li>An approved graduate-level course in mathematical linguistics or automata theory.</li>
</ol><hr /><p><span>The most up to date version of requirements is always in </span><a href="http://exploredegrees.stanford.edu/schoolofhumanitiesandsciences/philosophy/#masterstext">exploredegrees</a><span>.   </span><a class="more-link" href="http://exploredegrees.stanford.edu/schoolofhumanitiesandsciences/philosophy/#masterstext">Check ma REQUIREMENTS</a></p>
</div></div></div></div></div>  </div>
    </article> </div>
</div></div>

                <div id="content" class="mc-content span9">
          <div id="content-wrapper" class="content-wrapper">
            <div id="content-head" class="row-fluid content-head">
                                                        <h1 class="title" id="page-title"> Bachelor&#039;s in Philosophy with Honors </h1>
                                                                                                </div>
                                                <div id="content-body" class="row-fluid content-body"> <div class="region region-content clearfix">
  <div id="block-system-main" class="clearfix block block-system">       <div class="content"> <article id="node-117" class="node node-stanford-page clearfix" about="/degree-programs/undergraduate/honors" typeof="sioc:Item foaf:Document">      <span property="dc:title" content="Bachelor&#039;s in Philosophy with Honors" class="rdf-meta element-hidden"></span>    <div class="content">
    <div id="node-stanford-page-full-group-s-postcard" class="postcard"><div id="node-stanford-page-full-group-s-postcard-content" class="postcard-content"><div class="field field-name-body field-type-text-with-summary field-label-hidden"><div class="field-items"><div class="field-item even" property="content:encoded"><p class="summary">Students who wish to undertake a more intensive and extensive program of study, including seminars and independent work, are invited to apply for the honors program Bing Honors College during <em><strong>winter quarter of the junior year</strong></em>.</p>
<h4>Please check the <a href="http://exploredegrees.stanford.edu/schoolofhumanitiesandsciences/philosophy/">Stanford Bulletin (ExploreDegrees)</a> for the most up to date requirements.</h4>
<h2>Bing Honors College</h2>
<h3><a href="http://undergrad.stanford.edu/programs/bing-honors-college">Bing Honors College</a> is a three-week summer program prior to the start of the senior year. Honors students work independently and with other participants to research and shape their honors thesis under the guidance of a Philosophy professor and the support of a philosophy graduate student teaching assistant. For more information, contact the Undergrad Student Services Administrator. </h3>
<h3> </h3>
<h3>Intended Plan of Study</h3>
<p>With their application, candidates should submit an intended plan of study for the remainder of the junior and the senior years. It should include at least 5 units of Senior Tutorial (PHIL 196 Tutorial, Senior Year) during Autumn and/or Winter quarter(s) of the senior year. Students who are applying to Honors College may use the same application for philosophy honors. In the quarter preceding the tutorial, students should submit an essay proposal to the Philosophy undergraduate director and determine an adviser.</p>
<h3>Honors Seminar (Junior Year)</h3>
<p>Students applying for honors should enroll in Junior Honors Seminar (PHIL 199 Seminar for Prospective Honors Students) during the Spring Quarter of the junior year.</p>
<h3>The Honors Thesis</h3>
<p>The length of the honors essay may vary considerably depending on the problem and the approach; usually it falls somewhere between 7,500 and 12,500 words. This essay may use work in previous seminars and courses as a starting point, but it cannot be the same essay that has been used, or is being used, in some other class or seminar. It must be a substantially new and different piece of work reflecting work in the tutorials.</p>
<p>A completed draft of the essay is submitted to the adviser at the end of the Winter Quarter of the senior year. Any further revisions must be finished by the fifth full week of the Spring Quarter, when three copies of the essay are to be given to the undergraduate secretary. The honors essay is graded by the adviser together with a second reader, chosen by the adviser in consultation with the student. The student also provides an oral defense of the thesis at a meeting with the adviser and second reader. The essay must receive a grade of 'A-' or better for the student to receive honors.</p>
<p>Notes: Admission is selective on the basis of demonstrated ability in Philosophy, including an average grade of at least 'A-' in a substantial number of Philosophy courses and progress towards satisfying the requirements of the major. <span>Honors tutorials represent units in addition to the 55-unit requirement.</span></p>
<hr /><h2>Stanford Undergraduate honors theses in Philosophy</h2>
<p>Follow the link below to browse titles of Philosophy Honors Theses that have been done at Stanford.  You can read these papers in the collection at <a href="https://philosophy.stanford.edu/about/tanner-memorial-library-philosophy">Tanner Philosophy Library</a>.</p>
<p><a class="more-link" href="https://philosophy.stanford.edu/undergraduate-honors-theses-philosophy">Philosophy Undergraduate Honors Theses Collection 1963 - 2014</a></p>
<p> </p>
</div></div></div></div></div>  </div>
    </article> </div>
</div></div>

<div id="block-menu-menu-footer-about-menu" class="clearfix block block-menu span2">     <h2>About</h2>
      <div class="content"> <ul class="menu nav"><li class="first leaf"><a href="/about">About Us</a></li>
<li class="leaf"><a href="/about/directions-parking-accommodations">Location</a></li>

  <div id="block-menu-block-2" class="clearfix block block-menu-block">     <h2>DEGREE PROGRAMS</h2>
      <div class="content"> <div class="menu-block-wrapper menu-block-2 menu-name-main-menu parent-mlid-0 menu-level-2">

<div id="block-views-stanford-person-student-block-1" class="clearfix block block-views">     <h2>Featured Undergraduate Students</h2>
      <div class="content"> <div class="view view-stanford-person-student view-id-stanford_person_student view-display-id-block_1 views-row-lines view-stanford-person view-dom-id-48e318f5a1fcdb165cc7ac5fe3fe89dc">
        
  
  
      <div class="view-content">
        <div class="views-row views-row-1 views-row-odd views-row-first views-row-last">
      
          <div class="stanford-person">
 <img typeof="foaf:Image" src="https://philosophy.stanford.edu/sites/default/files/styles/sm-square/public/ryu.jpg?itok=6i9WSc9N" width="100" height="100" alt="" />
  <h3><a href="/people/royce-ryu">Royce Ryu</a></h3>

        <!-- /#sidebar-first -->
                <div id="content" class="mc-content span9">
          <div id="content-wrapper" class="content-wrapper">
            <div id="content-head" class="row-fluid content-head">
                                                        <h1 class="title" id="page-title"> Bachelor of Arts in Philosophy  </h1>
                                                                                                </div>
                                                <div id="content-body" class="row-fluid content-body"> <div class="region region-content clearfix">
  <div id="block-system-main" class="clearfix block block-system">       <div class="content"> <article id="node-123" class="node node-stanford-page clearfix" about="/degree-programs/undergraduate/major" typeof="sioc:Item foaf:Document">      <span property="dc:title" content="Bachelor of Arts in Philosophy " class="rdf-meta element-hidden"></span>    <div class="content">
    <div id="node-stanford-page-full-group-s-postcard" class="postcard"><div id="node-stanford-page-full-group-s-postcard-content" class="postcard-content"><div class="field field-name-body field-type-text-with-summary field-label-hidden"><div class="field-items"><div class="field-item even" property="content:encoded"><h2>Major</h2>
<p class="summary"><span>Students may earn a B.A. in Philosophy that explores traditional areas of philosophy or pursue a concentration within the major in <a href="https://philosophy.stanford.edu/degree-programs/undergraduate-degree/major/philosophy-and-literature-concentration">Philosophy and Literature</a> or <a href="https://philosophy.stanford.edu/degree-programs/undergraduate-degree/major/history-and-philosophy-science">History and Philosophy of Science</a>. </span></p>
<h4>Please check the <a href="http://exploredegrees.stanford.edu/schoolofhumanitiesandsciences/philosophy/">Stanford Bulletin (ExploreDegrees)</a> for the most up to date requirements.</h4>
<h2>B.A. in Philosophy (Traditional)</h2>
<p>Combined minimum of 55 units as follows:</p>
<h3>I. Introductory course requirements (2 courses):</h3>
<p>  i. One introductory course (any course number smaller than 100); and</p>
<p>  ii. PHIL: 80 Mind, Matter, and Meaning</p>
<p>Notes:</p>
<ul><li>
		<p><span>PHIL 80: Mind, Matter, and Meaning should normally be taken no later than the </span><em>first quarter after declaring the major</em><span>. </span></p>
	</li>
	<li>
		<p>Students taking a Philosophy Thinking Matters course can count 4 units toward the introductory Philosophy requirement.</p>
	</li>
	<li>
		<p>Students who took the Winter/Spring Philosophy Introduction to the Humanities (IHUM) track may count 5 units toward the Introductory Philosophy requirement. (IHUM courses are no longer offered).</p>
	</li>
</ul><h3>II. Core Requirements:</h3>
<p>  i. Logic (PHIL 49, 50, 150, 151, or 154)</p>
<p>  ii. Philosophy of science (PHIL 60, 61, or PHIL 160s)</p>
<p>  iii. Moral and political philosophy (PHIL 2, PHIL 170-172, or 174-176)</p>
<p>  iv. Contemporary theoretical philosophy (PHIL 180s)</p>
<p>  v. History of philosophy (PHIL 100 and 102)</p>
<p>Any units taken for a letter grade in fulfillment of the core requirements above must be completed with a  grade of C- or higher.</p>
<h3>III. Undergraduate Seminar:</h3>
<p>  i. One undergraduate philosophy seminar from the PHIL 194 series.</p>
<h3>IV. Electives (17 units minimum):</h3>
<p>  i. At least 9 units in courses numbered PHIL 99 and higher.</p>
<h3>V. Tutorial:</h3>
<p>  i. Units for Tutorial, Directed Reading (PHIL 196: Tutorial, Senior Year; PHIL 197: Individual Work, Undergraduate), The Dualist (PHIL 198: The Dualist), Honors Seminar (PHIL 199: Seminar for Prospective Honors Students), or affiliated courses may not be counted in the 55-unit requirement. No more than 10 units completed with grades of 'satisfactory' and/or 'credit' may be counted in the 55-unit requirement.</p>
<p>  ii. A maximum of 10 transfer units or two courses can be used for the departmental major. In general, transfer courses cannot be used to satisfy the six area requirements or the undergraduate seminar requirement. Students may not substitute transfer units for the PHIL 80 requirement.</p>
<p> </p>
<p>For more information on courses, see the <a href="http://exploredegrees.stanford.edu/schoolofhumanitiesandsciences/philosophy/#bachelorstext">Stanford Bulletin Philosophy Bachelor's Page.</a></p>
<p>For those who wish to declare a major in Philosophy, please contact the undergraduate administrator to get the General Program Major Declaration Packet.</p>
<div> </div>
<p> </p>
</div></div></div></div></div>  </div>
    </article> </div>
</div></div>

</ul></div>
 </div>
</div></div>
 <!-- /.region -->
                          </nav>
          </div>

                <div id="content" class="mc-content span9">
          <div id="content-wrapper" class="content-wrapper">
            <div id="content-head" class="row-fluid content-head">
                                                        <h1 class="title" id="page-title"> Courses: All Quarters </h1>
                                                                                                </div>
                                                <div id="content-body" class="row-fluid content-body"> <div class="region region-content clearfix">
  <div id="block-system-main" class="clearfix block block-system">       <div class="content"> <div class="view view-courses view-id-courses view-display-id-academic_year_courses_page view-dom-id-f96f0f86c7ccb58b9daf916eb25a3338">
        
  
  
      <div class="view-content">
      <table class="views-table cols-6" >
         <thead>
      <tr>
                  <th class="views-field views-field-title"  scope="col">
            Title          </th>
                  <th class="views-field views-field-field-s-course-person"  scope="col">

            2015-2016 Spring          </td>
                  <td class="views-field views-field-field-s-course-dow" >
            <div>Thursday</div> <div>12:00pm - 1:20pm</div> <div>60-119</div>          </td>
              </tr>
      </tbody>
</table>
    </div>
  
      <h2 class="element-invisible">Pages</h2><div class="item-list"><ul class="pager"><li class="pager-first first"><a title="Go to first page" href="/courses/academic-year">« first</a></li>

</div></div>

            2016-2017 Summer          </td>
                  <td class="views-field views-field-field-s-course-dow descriptor" >
            <div>Tuesday Thursday</div><div>3:30pm - 4:50pm</div><div></div><div></div>          </td>
              </tr>
      </tbody>
</table>
    </div>
  
      <h2 class="element-invisible">Pages</h2><div class="item-list"><ul class="pager"><li class="pager-current first">1</li>

      <div class="navbar">
                <div class="navbar-inner">
                              <div id="nav-search" class="nav-search"> <div class="region region-search-box clearfix">
  <div id="block-search-form" class="clearfix block block-search" role="search">       <div class="content"> <form action="/courses/search?page=1" method="post" id="search-block-form" accept-charset="UTF-8"><div><div class="container-inline">
      <h2 class="element-invisible">Search form</h2>
    <div class="form-item form-type-textfield form-item-search-block-form">
  <label class="element-invisible" for="edit-search-block-form--2">Search </label>

  <div id="block-menu-block-2" class="clearfix block block-menu-block">     <h2>COURSES</h2>
      <div class="content"> <div class="menu-block-wrapper menu-block-2 menu-name-main-menu parent-mlid-0 menu-level-2">
  <ul class="menu nav"><li class="first leaf menu-mlid-1602"><a href="/courses/current-courses" title="">Current Quarter</a></li>

<div id="block-views-85c57f65aa0dee37d8aa5a5031e564bc" class="clearfix block block-views well">     <h2>find a course</h2>
      <div class="content"> <form action="/courses/search" method="get" id="views-exposed-form-courses-reference-search-page" accept-charset="UTF-8"><div><div class="views-exposed-form">
  <div class="views-exposed-widgets clearfix">
          <div id="edit-combine-wrapper" class="views-exposed-widget views-widget-filter-combine">
                  <label for="edit-combine">
            Search course by title or number          </label>
                        <div class="views-widget">
          <div class="form-item form-type-textfield form-item-combine">

                              <div id="nav-search" class="nav-search"> <div class="region region-search-box clearfix">
  <div id="block-search-form" class="clearfix block block-search" role="search">       <div class="content"> <form action="/courses/search?page=12" method="post" id="search-block-form" accept-charset="UTF-8"><div><div class="container-inline">
      <h2 class="element-invisible">Search form</h2>
    <div class="form-item form-type-textfield form-item-search-block-form">
  <label class="element-invisible" for="edit-search-block-form--2">Search </label>
 <input title="Enter the terms you wish to search for." class="input-medium search-query form-text" placeholder="Search this site..." type="text" id="edit-search-block-form--2" name="search_block_form" value="" size="15" maxlength="128" />

<div id="block-views-85c57f65aa0dee37d8aa5a5031e564bc" class="clearfix block block-views well">     <h2>find a course</h2>

  <div id="block-search-form" class="clearfix block block-search" role="search">       <div class="content"> <form action="/courses/search?page=15" method="post" id="search-block-form" accept-charset="UTF-8"><div><div class="container-inline">

  <div id="block-bean-support-philosophy-footer-block" class="clearfix block block-bean span2">       <div class="content"> <div class="entity entity-bean bean-stanford-postcard clearfix" about="/block/support-philosophy-footer-block" typeof="">

  <div class="content">
    <div id="bean-stanford-postcard-full-group-s-postcard" class="postcard"><div id="bean-stanford-postcard-full-group-s-postcard-content" class="postcard-content"><div class="field field-name-field-s-postcard-body field-type-text-with-summary field-label-hidden"><div class="field-items"><div class="field-item even"><p><a href="http://giving.stanford.edu/goto/philosophygift"><img alt="Make a Gift" src="https://philosophy.stanford.edu/sites/default/files/make-gift.png" title="" /></a></p>
</div></div></div><div class="field field-name-field-s-postcard-link field-type-link-field field-label-hidden"><div class="field-items"><div class="field-item even"><a href="https://philosophy.stanford.edu/about/giving" class="more-link">Support Philosophy at Stanford</a></div></div></div></div></div>  </div>

  <div id="block-menu-block-3" class="clearfix block block-menu-block">     <h2>Main menu</h2>

  <div id="block-menu-block-2" class="clearfix block block-menu-block">     <h2>COURSES</h2>
      <div class="content"> <div class="menu-block-wrapper menu-block-2 menu-name-main-menu parent-mlid-0 menu-level-2">
  <ul class="menu nav"><li class="first leaf menu-mlid-1602"><a href="/courses/current-courses" title="">Current Quarter</a></li>

<div id="block-views-85c57f65aa0dee37d8aa5a5031e564bc" class="clearfix block block-views well">     <h2>find a course</h2>
      <div class="content"> <form action="/courses/search" method="get" id="views-exposed-form-courses-reference-search-page" accept-charset="UTF-8"><div><div class="views-exposed-form">
  <div class="views-exposed-widgets clearfix">
          <div id="edit-combine-wrapper" class="views-exposed-widget views-widget-filter-combine">
                  <label for="edit-combine">
            Search course by title or number          </label>
                        <div class="views-widget">
          <div class="form-item form-type-textfield form-item-combine">
 <input type="text" id="edit-combine" name="combine" value="" size="30" maxlength="128" class="form-text" />
</div>
        </div>
              </div>
          <div id="edit-field-subfield-tid-wrapper" class="views-exposed-widget views-widget-filter-field_subfield_tid">
                  <label for="edit-field-subfield-tid">
            Subfield          </label>
                        <div class="views-widget">
          <div class="form-item form-type-select form-item-field-subfield-tid">
 <select id="edit-field-subfield-tid" name="field_subfield_tid" class="form-select"><option value="All" selected="selected">- Any -</option><option value="429">Contemporary Theoretical Philosophy</option><option value="49">Ethics &amp; Value Theory</option><option value="53">Freshman Seminars</option><option value="41">History of Philosophy</option><option value="433">Introductory</option><option value="45">Logic</option><option value="439">PhilLit Gateway</option><option value="47">Philosophy of Science</option><option value="55">Special Seminars</option><option value="435">Symsys Gateway</option><option value="51">Tutorial</option><option value="437">Writing in the Major (WiM)</option></select>
</div>
        </div>
              </div>
          <div id="edit-field-s-course-term-value-wrapper" class="views-exposed-widget views-widget-filter-field_s_course_term_value">
                  <label for="edit-field-s-course-term-value">
            Quarter          </label>
                        <div class="views-widget">
          <div class="form-item form-type-select form-item-field-s-course-term-value">
 <select id="edit-field-s-course-term-value" name="field_s_course_term_value" class="form-select"><option value="All" selected="selected">- Any -</option><option value="Autumn">Autumn</option><option value="Winter">Winter</option><option value="Spring">Spring</option><option value="Summer">Summer</option></select>
</div>
        </div>
              </div>
          <div id="edit-field-s-course-section-year-value-selective-wrapper" class="views-exposed-widget views-widget-filter-field_s_course_section_year_value_selective">
                  <label for="edit-field-s-course-section-year-value-selective">
            Academic Year          </label>
                        <div class="views-widget">
          <div class="form-item form-type-select form-item-field-s-course-section-year-value-selective">
 <select id="edit-field-s-course-section-year-value-selective" name="field_s_course_section_year_value_selective" class="form-select"><option value="All" selected="selected">- Any -</option><option value="2013">2013-2014</option><option value="2014">2014-2015</option><option value="2015">2015-2016</option><option value="2016">2016-2017</option><option value="2017">2017-2018</option></select>
</div>
        </div>
              </div>
          <div id="edit-field-s-course-instructor-value-wrapper" class="views-exposed-widget views-widget-filter-field_s_course_instructor_value">

                                                        <h1 class="title" id="page-title"> Courses </h1>
                                                                                                </div>
                                                <div id="content-body" class="row-fluid content-body"> <div class="region region-content clearfix">
  <div id="block-system-main" class="clearfix block block-system">       <div class="content"> <div class="view view-courses-reference view-id-courses_reference view-display-id-search_page view-dom-id-f7641720a1e660b7fca991ca9a53e57b">
        
  
  
      <div class="view-content">
      <table class="views-table cols-5" >
         <thead>
      <tr>
                  <th class="views-field views-field-title"  scope="col">
            Title          </th>
                  <th class="views-field views-field-field-s-course-instructor"  scope="col">
            Instructor(s)          </th>
                  <th class="views-field views-field-field-subfield"  scope="col">
            Subfield          </th>
                  <th class="views-field views-field-field-s-course-section-year"  scope="col">
            Quarter          </th>
                  <th class="views-field views-field-field-s-course-dow"  scope="col">
            Day, Time, Location          </th>
              </tr>
    </thead>
    <tbody>
          <tr class="odd views-row-first">
                  <td class="views-field views-field-title" >
            PHIL 500 (section 1)<br /><a href="http://explorecourses.stanford.edu/search?view=catalog&amp;filter-coursestatus-Active=on&amp;page=0&amp;catalog=&amp;q=PHIL500">Advanced Dissertation Seminar</a>          </td>
                  <td class="views-field views-field-field-s-course-instructor" >
            <a href="/people/anna-sara-malmgren">Anna-Sara Malmgren</a>Malmgren, A.Malmgren, A.          </td>
                  <td class="views-field views-field-field-subfield" >
                      </td>
                  <td class="views-field views-field-field-s-course-section-year" >
            2017-2018 Spring          </td>
                  <td class="views-field views-field-field-s-course-dow descriptor" >
            <div>Monday Wednesday</div><div>2:30pm - 5:20pm</div><div>90-92Q</div><div></div>          </td>
              </tr>
          <tr class="even views-row-last">
                  <td class="views-field views-field-title" >
            THINK 45 (section 1)<br /><a href="http://explorecourses.stanford.edu/search?view=catalog&amp;filter-coursestatus-Active=on&amp;q=THINK45">Thinking About the Universe: What do we know? How do we know it? (THINK 45)</a>          </td>
                  <td class="views-field views-field-field-s-course-instructor" >
            <a href="/people/thomas-ryckman">Thomas Ryckman</a>P. Michelson and P. Graham          </td>
                  <td class="views-field views-field-field-subfield" >
            Philosophy of Science          </td>
                  <td class="views-field views-field-field-s-course-section-year" >
            2014-2015 Winter          </td>
                  <td class="views-field views-field-field-s-course-dow descriptor" >
            <div>Monday, Wednesday </div><div>11:00am - 11:50am</div><div>370-370</div><div></div>          </td>

MAP aims to promote diversity and awareness within the discipline about issues concerning and confronting unrepresented groups within academic philosophy.">Minorities and Philosophy, Stanford Chapter</a></li>
</ul></li>
<li class="last expanded menu-mlid-1165 dropdown"><a href="/events" class="dropdown-toggle" data-toggle="dropdown" data-target="#">NEWS & EVENTS <span class="caret"></span></a><ul class="dropdown-menu"><li class="first leaf menu-mlid-1592"><a href="/news/recent-news" title="">Recent News</a></li>
<li class="leaf has-children menu-mlid-1167"><a href="/events/upcoming-events">Upcoming Events</a></li>
<li class="leaf menu-mlid-1169"><a href="/events/past-events">Past Events</a></li>
<li class="leaf has-children menu-mlid-1545"><a href="/events/upcoming-events/departmental-events/colloquium-series">Colloquium Series</a></li>
<li class="last leaf has-children menu-mlid-1657"><a href="/events/departmental-events/kant-lectures">Kant Lectures</a></li>
</ul></li>
</ul></div>
 </div>
</div></div>
 <!-- /.region -->
                          </nav>
          </div>

                  <td class="views-field views-field-field-s-course-section-year" >
            2015-2016 Autumn          </td>
                  <td class="views-field views-field-field-s-course-dow descriptor" >
            <div>Tuesday Thursday</div><div>1:30pm - 2:50pm</div><div>70-72A1</div><div></div>          </td>
              </tr>
          <tr class="even">
                  <td class="views-field views-field-title" >
            PHIL 90P (section 1)<br /><a href="http://explorecourses.stanford.edu/search?view=catalog&amp;filter-coursestatus-Active=on&amp;page=0&amp;catalog=&amp;q=PHIL90P">Is logic a source of metaphysical knowledge?</a>          </td>

                <div id="content" class="mc-content span9">
          <div id="content-wrapper" class="content-wrapper">
            <div id="content-head" class="row-fluid content-head">
                                                        <h1 class="title" id="page-title"> Courses </h1>
                                                                                                </div>
                                                <div id="content-body" class="row-fluid content-body"> <div class="region region-content clearfix">
  <div id="block-system-main" class="clearfix block block-system">       <div class="content"> <div class="view view-courses-reference view-id-courses_reference view-display-id-search_page view-dom-id-401e549a3accf9e772d22c99b0b85f53">
        
  
  
      <div class="view-content">
      <table class="views-table cols-5" >
         <thead>
      <tr>
                  <th class="views-field views-field-title"  scope="col">
            Title          </th>
                  <th class="views-field views-field-field-s-course-instructor"  scope="col">
            Instructor(s)          </th>
                  <th class="views-field views-field-field-subfield"  scope="col">
            Subfield          </th>
                  <th class="views-field views-field-field-s-course-section-year"  scope="col">
            Quarter          </th>
                  <th class="views-field views-field-field-s-course-dow"  scope="col">
            Day, Time, Location          </th>
              </tr>
    </thead>
    <tbody>
          <tr class="odd views-row-first">
                  <td class="views-field views-field-title" >
            PHIL 116 (section 1)<br /><a href="http://explorecourses.stanford.edu/search?view=catalog&amp;filter-coursestatus-Active=on&amp;page=0&amp;catalog=&amp;q=PHIL116">Aquinas (PHIL 216)</a>          </td>
                  <td class="views-field views-field-field-s-course-instructor" >
            Duarte, S.          </td>
                  <td class="views-field views-field-field-subfield" >
                      </td>

                  <td class="views-field views-field-field-s-course-section-year" >
            2015-2016 Spring          </td>
                  <td class="views-field views-field-field-s-course-dow descriptor" >
            <div>Thursday</div><div>4:30pm - 5:20pm</div><div>360-361A</div><div></div>          </td>
              </tr>
          <tr class="odd">
                  <td class="views-field views-field-title" >
            PHIL 170B (section 1)<br /><a href="http://explorecourses.stanford.edu/search?view=catalog&amp;filter-coursestatus-Active=on&amp;page=0&amp;catalog=&amp;q=PHIL170B">Metaphor (PHIL 270B)</a>          </td>

            Hills, D.Hills, D.          </td>

              </tr>
          <tr class="even views-row-last">

  <div id="global-header">
    <div class="container">
      <div class="row-fluid">
        <div id="top-logo" class="span4"><a href="http://www.stanford.edu"><img src="/sites/all/themes/stanford_framework/images/header-stanford-logo@2x.png" alt="Stanford University"></a></div>

                <div id="content" class="mc-content span9">
          <div id="content-wrapper" class="content-wrapper">
            <div id="content-head" class="row-fluid content-head">
                                                        <h1 class="title" id="page-title"> Courses </h1>

      <div class="content"> <ul class="menu nav"><li class="first leaf"><a href="/degree-programs/affiliated-programs/computer-science-and-philosophy" title="">CS+Philosophy</a></li>

</ul> </div>
</div>

<li class="expanded menu-mlid-1590 dropdown"><a href="/student-life" title="" class="dropdown-toggle" data-toggle="dropdown" data-target="#">STUDENT LIFE <span class="caret"></span></a><ul class="dropdown-menu"><li class="first leaf has-children menu-mlid-1591"><a href="/student-life/graduate-life">Graduate Life</a></li>

</ul></li>

  <div id="block-menu-block-2" class="clearfix block block-menu-block">     <h2>COURSES</h2>
      <div class="content"> <div class="menu-block-wrapper menu-block-2 menu-name-main-menu parent-mlid-0 menu-level-2">
